# The British Empire: A survey

The British Empire: A survey is a series of twelve books, each self-contained, published for educational purposes during the British Empire Exhibition in Wembley Park, London, by Collins in 1924, following the request of the Exhibition's management towards the Imperial Studies Committee of the Royal Colonial Institute to create this work.
The series' General Editor was Hugh Gunn and the Advisory Committee members were Sir Charles P. Lucas, KCB, KCMG (Chairman); The Rt Hon Lord Morris, KCMG, LL.D.; Sir Harry Wilson, KCMG, KBE; Arthur Percival Newton, M.A., D.Litt., B.Sc., F.S.A.; and the late Sir George R. Parkin, KCMG, LL.D.
The volumes
*I. The Dominions and Dependencies of the Empire, Forewords by HRH the Duke of Connaught and the Rt. Hon. Leo Amery, First Lord of the Admiralty: 13 chapters by various authors
*II. [https://archive.org/details/thestoryoftheemp009421mbp/page/n11 The Story of the Empire], by Sir Charles Lucas
*III. [https://archive.org/details/thestoryoftheemp009421mbp/page/n11The Constitution, Administration, and Laws of the Empire], by Prof. A. Berriedale Keith
*IV. [https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.172664/page/n9 The Resources of the Empire and Their Development], by Evans Lewin
*V. [https://archive.org/details/EmpireHealth/page/n9 Health Problems of the Empire - Past, Present, and Future] by Dr. Andrew Balfour and Dr. H. H. Scott
*VI. [https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.168643/page/n9 The Press and Communications of the Empire], by J. Saxon Mills
*VII. [https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.172666/page/n12 The Trade, Commerce, and Shipping of the Empire], by Sir Charles McLeod and Prof. A. W. Kirkaldy
*VIII. [https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.174138/page/n10 Makers of the Empire], by Hugh Gunn
*IX. [https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.172732/page/n9 The Native Races of the Empire], by Sir Godfrey Lagden
*X. [https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.172663/page/n12 The Universities and Educational Systems of the Empire], by Arthur Percival Newton
*XI. [https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=mdp.39015066342190&view=1up&seq=17 The Literature of the Empire and The Art of the Empire] by Edward Salmon and Major A. A. Longden
*XII. Migration Within the Empire, by Major E. A. Belcher and James A. Williamson
